djangotailoring.views.protection¶

Protection provides a pair of Mixin classes that automatically redirect users in a particular state when accessing the page.

Mixins¶

class djangotailoring.views.protection.UserPassesTestMixin¶

A mix-in class that validates that the requesting user meets a certain set of criteria. This leverages Django’s django.contrib.auth.decorators.user_passes_test() decorator. The attributes below are passed to the decorator as well. The test is provided by overriding the user_passes_test() method.

login_url¶

See the Django documentation for login_required for more information.

redirect_field_name¶

See the Django documentation for login_required for more information.

In addition, the following methods provide access to the above attributes:

get_login_url(self)¶

Used when determining what to pass as the login_url to the test decorator. By default, returns login_url.

get_redirect_field_name(self)¶

Used when determining what to pass as the redirect_field_name to the test decorator. By default, returns redirect_field_name.

Finally, the actual test that is performed on the user is done in:

user_passes_test(self, user)¶
Return type:a boolean
Returns:whether user should be able to access the view.

By default, returns True. For more information, see the user_passes_test documentation

class djangotailoring.views.protection.LoginRequiredMixin¶

A mix-in class that forces any access of the implementing view class to be accessible only to logged-in users. The behavior is the same as django’s django.contrib.auth.decorators.login_required() decorator.
